newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London track FTSE and HSBC.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London track FTSE and HSBC.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in London finished higher on Tuesday, spurred by activity in the bank sector and led by gains in benchmark stock HSBC, traders said.
The Hang Seng London Reference Index ended 33.01 points up at 13,939.47. Hong Kong stocks tracked a higher FTSE 100 index but finished off their best levels as Wall Street chalked up losses.
"We ran up early on with Hong Kong bank (HSBC) on the back of the FTSE but since then the Dow led us to the lower levels of the day," said one trader.
All the action was in the banks, dealers said. "Turnover was big compared with what we've seen over the last couple of days," one said.
HSBC finished at HK$219.6 in London after a Hong Kong close of HK$217.0.
